title: iPhone 8 and 7S to launch at September 12 Apple event – report
description:
![Tim
Cook](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

  * [iPhone](https://www.trustedreviews.com/tag/iphone)

**A pair of new reports claim to reveal when Apple will launch the[iPhone
8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/iphone-8-release-date-specs-rumours-
price-uk-2993101) and [iPhone
7S](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/iphone-7s-release-date-plus-specs-
price-news-rumours-2950260) this year, but should they be treated with a pinch
of salt? We dissect the latest rumours.**

Speculation has been rife about when Apple will unveil its next handsets, but
while history teaches us that ‘some time in September’ is a good idea of when
the new iPhone will launch, we haven’t really been able to pin a date to the
year’s biggest smartphone reveal.

Until now?

The first [report](https://www.mac4ever.com/actu/124206_keynote-
iphone-8-le-12-septembre-se-confirme-du-cote-des-operateurs) comes to us from
French fanboy blog Mac4Ever, which says ‘carrier sources’ have revealed that
Apple will be holding its next product launch on Tuesday September 12.

The site has a mixed track record when it comes to Apple rumours, but there’s
nothing too wild about this one – Apple typically launches its new iPhones in
the second week of September, on either the Tuesday or the Wednesday, with
last year’s iPhone 7 reveal taking place on Wednesday September 7.

If accurate, that would likely mean iPhone 8 pre-orders going live on Friday
September 15, ahead of a September 22 final release date.

Now, the Wall Street Journal is also
[saying](https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-to-hold-product-launch-event-on-
sept-12-1503928157) that September 12 is the day to mark on your calendars,
citing “people familiar with its plans.”

It’s more difficult to pick holes in the WSJ’s track record, though while it
is reliable, it’s also not perfect. Plus, Apple likes nothing more than to
spring a surprise, so we’d stress that nothing is set in stone until Apple
mails out official iPhone launch invites.

We think this will happen towards the end of next week, so as to best spoil
the [IFA 2017](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ifa-2017-news-rumours-
highlights-2993271) party and put a damper on new phones from rivals like LG
and Sony.

As well as the iPhone 8 and 7S/7S Plus, Apple is being tipped to reveal a
special [10 Year Anniversary Edition
iPhone](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/iphone-10-year-anniversary-
edition-news-rumours-price-release-date-specs-features-2951157) this autumn,
and a host of updates to other key product lines.

Most notably, these include the [Apple Watch
3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-watch-3-release-date-
series-3-rumours-features-price-3196092) and a [4K Apple
TV,](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/4k-apple-tv-release-date-news-
rumours-specs-price-2953139) but we’re also expecting to get more details on
its nascent [HomePod](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-homepod-
release-date-price-specs-features-uk-2950931) smart home speaker.

That’s the latest news, but stay tuned as more information should become
available soon.
